intro: Erythrodes latifolia var. johorense, commonly known as the Johor broadleaf erythrodes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
